required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: General Drug Use-results Survey on PROPESS Vaginal Inserts in Treatment for Initiation of Cervical Ripening in Patients at Term (From 37 Completed Weeks of Gestation)
clinical_study.official_title: General Drug Use-results Survey on PROPESSÂ® Vaginal Inserts 10 mg in Treatment for Initiation of Cervical Ripening in Patients at Term (From 37 Completed Weeks of Gestation)

brief_summary.textblock: To confirm and consider the occurrence of important identified risks described in the Japanese Pharmaceutical Risk Management Plan (J-RMP) under conditions used in routine medical practice. The safety specification include: uterine hypercontractions and associated foetal distress, uterine rupture, cervical laceration, amniotic fluid embolism, and foetal distress.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions associated with uterine hypercontractions
primary_outcome.time_frame: From administration of the drug to 24 hours after administration of the drug or 2 hours after birth whichever is longer
primary_outcome.description: Events defined as uterine hypercontractions were uterine hyperstimulation, uterine tachysystole, uterine hypertonus, uterine contractions abnormal.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions associated with foetal distress
primary_outcome.time_frame: From administration of the drug to 24 hours after administration of the drug or 2 hours after birth whichever is longer
primary_outcome.description: Events defined as foetal distress were abnormal labour affecting foetus, foetal heart rate disorder, foetal heart rate deceleration abnormality, bradycardia foetal, foetal heart rate abnormal, foetal heart rate decreased, foetal heart rate increased, tachycardia foetal, foetal acidosis, meconium in amniotic fluid, apgar score low, encephalopathy neonatal, arrhythmia neonatal, baseline foetal heart rate variability disorder, bradycardia neonatal, foetal arrhythmia, nonreassuring foetal heart rate pattern, cyanosis neonatal, infantile apnoea, neonatal anoxia, neonatal asphyxia, neonatal hypoxia, neonatal respiratory depression, foetal distress syndrome, foetal monitoring abnormal, neonatal respiratory distress syndrome, neonatal respiratory distress.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions of foetal distress, uterine rupture, cervical laceration and amniotic fluid embolus in patients with uterine hypercontractions
primary_outcome.time_frame: From administration of the drug to 24 hours after administration of the drug or 2 hours after birth whichever is longer

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions by background factors affecting the occurrence of foetal distress
primary_outcome.time_frame: From administration of the drug to 24 hours after administration of the drug or 2 hours after birth whichever is longer
primary_outcome.description: Adverse drug reactions incidence rate by background factors such as patient age, height, weight, smoking history, medical history, pregnancy related disease, history of surgery on the uterus and cervix, presence or absence of uterine hypercontractions at the time of the previous parturition and concomitant medications, affecting the occurrence of foetal distress will be presented.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From administration of the drug to 24 hours after administration of the drug or 2 hours after birth whichever is longer
From administration of the drug to 24 hours after administration of the drug or 2 hours after birth whichever is longer

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions by background factors affecting the overall safety of the product
primary_outcome.time_frame: From administration of the drug to 24 hours after administration of the drug or 2 hours after birth whichever is longer
primary_outcome.description: Adverse drug reactions incidence rate by background factors such as patient age, height, weight, smoking history, medical history, history of surgery on the uterus and cervix, presence or absence of uterine hypercontractions at the time of the previous parturition and concomitant medications, affecting the overall safety of the product will be presented.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions/adverse events in the foetuses and newborns
primary_outcome.time_frame: From administration of the drug to 24 hours after administration of the drug or 2 hours after birth whichever is longer

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of newborns with an Apgar score of less than 7 at 5 minutes after parturition
primary_outcome.time_frame: From administration of the drug to 24 hours after administration of the drug or 2 hours after birth whichever is longer

study_pop.textblock: Patients who received the PROPESS in treatment for initiation of cervical ripening in patients at term (from 37 completed weeks of gestation).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who received the PROPESS in treatment for initiation of cervical ripening in patients at term (from 37 completed weeks of gestation). This prospective survey is an observational (non-interventional) survey for re-examination of the safety profile of PROPESS. It only collects data under conditions of use in routine medical practices.
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

facility.name: Osaka University Hospital (there may be other sites in this country)
